intro: Lobelia uranocoma, commonly known as the silverleaf lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and clusters of small, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Lobelia uranocoma is also valued for its ability to thrive in cool, moist conditions.
